name: uncanonical
content:
uncanonical adjective
(RELIGION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
religion
  formal or specialized not following the rules, principles, or laws of the Christian Church: He attempted to impose unity by uncanonical coercion against six clergy in his diocese.
More examplesFewer examplesThe church authorities do not accept the uncanonical and unlawful activities that have recently come to light in the parish.The testimony is wrongfully rejected by the adversaries as being uncanonical. He was dethroned by the Holy Synod because of his un-canonical practices.

uncanonical adjective
(ART)
formal An uncanonical work of art, literature, etc. is not part of the canon (= works that are generally agreed to be good, important, and worth studying): The anthology surprises us with the rediscovery of formerly uncanonical poems and poets.
More examplesFewer examplesHe is a connoisseur of the uncanonical hybrid in art.His early work is rarely displayed and is considered uncanonical, probably embarrassing. She examines three uncanonical Victorian texts and two postcolonial novels.
